description.narrative: Total Commitment in Third Quarter of 2020
Total Disbursement in First Quarter of 2021

condition.narrative: Conditions of Effectiveness consist of the following:(a) The PKSF Subsidiary Agreement has been executed on behalf of theRecipient and PKSF and all conditions precedent to its effectiveness or to the right of PKSF to make withdrawals under it (otherthan the effectiveness of this Agreement) have been fulfilled.(b) The Co-financing Agreement has been executed and delivered andall conditions precedent to its effectiveness or to the right of the Recipient to make withdrawals under it (other than theeffectiveness of this Agreement) have been fulfilled.(c) The Project Implementation Manual, in a form and substance satisfactoryto the Association has been adopted and put into effect by DPHE and PKSF respectively.(d) The Project director and Projectcoordinator for each of the Implementing Agencies have been selected and recruited.

title.narrative: % of piped water schemes using solar photovoltaic (PV) as their main energy source
# of piped water schemes that are in continuous operations for 20 months or longer
Amount of MFI financing mobilized (in BDT)
# of public officials at the local level (Upazilas, UPs, health workers) trained
# of public toilets that are in continuous operations for 20 months or longer
% of project area households who benefited from the project activities under Subcomponents 1.1, 1.2, 1.3, or 2.2
# of LEs trained on 'safely-managed' WASH infrastructure
% of community water management committees whose chair is woman
People provided with access to improved sanitation services
The number of policy documents under the National Strategy for Water Supply and Sanitation adopted or endorsed
The number of MFIs which adopted their own WASH lending policy and allocated capital for WASH loans
People provided with access to improved water sources
# of sanitary napkins sold by female LEs who received loans for sanitary napkins business
% of ISPPP beneficiaries in project locations who receive WASH-specific BCC messages on a monthly basis
The number of handwashing stations built with running water and soap available
# of Upazilas that established and are using the monitoring system
% of households paying their water tariffs on time (i.e. collection efficiency rate)
% of users who are overall satisfied with improved access to quality WASH services
% of water quality tests that meet national standards
